eventName: Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures
storyInfo: Jessica feels simultaneously furious and powerless as Blacksteel works together with the bank to carry on evicting the debt-ridden residents. Woodrow goes looking for 'Clip' Cliff at night.

attributes.content: ...Why is someone still outside this late?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Is that... Jessica?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: What brings you here at this hour, Miss?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: I... *huff*, *huff* I... have some business here!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: L-Let's... talk inside, shall we?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: What's going on, Sylvia? Didn't I tell you to keep the door closed at night? Recently those people from Blacksteel have been—
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Ah. So it was you, Miss.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I'm not sure why you've paid us a visit at this hour, but how may I serve you?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Don't... don't chase them out!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Chase them out? Who exactly?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: The residents with debt! Don't let Blacksteel drive them out!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Who's this coming from? Mr. Cliff?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I... it's from me!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Did I hear that right? If this is a joke, I'm not sure I get it.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I'm serious! If you need someone to pay off their debts, then I-I'll pay it off for them! At least enough to let them stay through winter? Sending them to the frontier now is no different from a death sentence!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What holds sway in a bank are not the delusions of a mercenary, but honest-to-goodness gold certificates.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I have the certs! This isn't a crazy fantasy, I can walk the walk and pay off their debts!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I'm sorry, but the bank doesn't have time to indulge your nonsense—
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I'm the daughter of Bernie Brynley... The CEO and largest shareholder of Raythean Industries!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica freezes on the spot as soon as she finishes speaking. Ever since she joined Blacksteel, she has never once relied on her father or her family to handle any setbacks she's faced.
This was her one unwavering insistence—she did not want any special treatment because of her family name.
But she had just unleashed the name of her father, as well as the one that sits on their family crest.
Bernie Brynley?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: You must be quite the bigshot then, Miss Jessica Brynley.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Spare me the sarcasm, ma'am. Just give me the number.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Hm... I can't give you an exact figure on the spot, but no matter. Sylvia is here, and she's always been good with numbers.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: What are you standing there for, Sylvia? Tell her.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: ...Miss, I—
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: She's a child of the Brynley family. It should be a paltry sum to her.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: This, this isn't a good idea...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Tell her, Sylvia!
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Currently... everyone's debt in Davistown roughly totals to... 276 million certs. If we calculate the interest until spring, the amount you'll need is roughly...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: How much?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: 28,450,000 gold certificates.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Twenty-eight... million?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: A small price for three months of peace and stability on the plate, no?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: At a loss for words, Miss Brynley?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I-I don't have that much on hand right now, b-but I can make the arrangements...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: 28,450,000... So even a trust fund heiress can't withdraw that much money in one go?
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: I've learned something new today.
attributes.name: Bank Manager

attributes.content: Jessica...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Sylvia, I-I...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You're... you're not from Davistown. There's really... no need to do this for our sake.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Listen to me. You should just leave... E-Even if you have enough for this time, could you afford the next one? Or the one after that?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Jessica's lips tremble as she fails to let even a single word out.
She knows Sylvia is not being wry, but just stating the facts.
The long string of numbers in her account can ensure a carefree lifetime for her, but isn't enough to guarantee even a month's stability for the people of this plate.
She thinks back to her father's earnest reminders—To always act within her means, and to weigh the pros and cons before doing so.
But she never learned to, and thus has no achievements to her name.
Sir? Are you in there?
attributes.name: Secretary

attributes.content: Yes. What's the matter?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: He's here. Is it a good time for you to meet?
attributes.name: Secretary

attributes.content: Sir?
attributes.name: Secretary

attributes.content: Yes, I heard you. Bring him in.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Jessica? Ain't you supposed to be back on the Blacksteel landship?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...Helena, is Woodrow back yet?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: No, he said he went out to see an old friend, and isn't back yet.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: You don't look so good... What's wrong? Did something happen to Woody?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: No... He must have gone to our landship to meet the boss. They're old friends, so... maybe he can change his mind.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: The boss of Blacksteel? He never told me he knew a bigshot like that.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Doesn't he have a photo of him and some other Sankta...?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Photo? That rings a bell, but ain't it always locked away in his drawer? How did you manage a look?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: That... that's not important. What's important is that the three in the photo were all smiles, right?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Are you sure Woody went to look for the man in the photo?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...So you do know something about them?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I dunno much about Woody's time in the Revolutionary War, and even less about the people in that photo...
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: But back then, it was your boss who made the choice that led to Woody and the other man getting captured by the enemy and locked up in Camp Collus.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...Is that... an internment camp?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You didn't know? Well, it's ancient history. No official would ever bring it up, so of course you young'uns wouldn't know about it.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: It was a POW camp built by the Victorian Army during the Columbian Revolutionary War. And what went on in there was... appalling. I'm talking torture.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Torture...?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Yeah. For every ten that went in, only one made it out.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: So Jessica, who'd ever call someone who left them to rot in a place like that an old friend...?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Jessica recalls the brown identification document.
She suddenly realizes that the document's color was not just a random shade of brown, but the color of dried blood.
Sir, are you in there?
Yes. What's the matter?
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: He's here, sir. Is it a good time for you to meet?
Yes, just bring him in.
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: ...May I sit?
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: We have chairs, Woody.
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: ...Sorry, got used to sitting on the ground these past two years. I forgot I can sit on chairs without... getting beat up.
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: Autumn 1019, Columbia, Camp Collus
...Calling me here... Got something to say to me?
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: I figured you'd be the one full of questions for me.
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: No, just the one.
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: Why didn't you back me up, three years ago?
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: The situation changed after you left. Once the enemy encirclement suddenly tightened around our right flank, I had no choice but to abandon the original rescue plan and conserve our forces.
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: ...You're gonna write it off with just that understatement?
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: You devised a rescue plan, sent me as a decoy, and in the end, you didn't even rescue him.
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: The circumstances compelled me to take responsibility for my men.
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: Don't give me that, with that face like you don't care!
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: Why are you so obsessed with my expressions, Woody? You've been scrutinizing my face since the moment I stepped in.
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: Since when did... Sankta ever need to pay attention to body language? What's going on, Woody?
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: ...It became a habit after he passed. After all, ain't no other Sankta in here.
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: When did he die? The document only has one 'dead' stamped in here, and the rest aren't even recorded.
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: I can't remember the details... Didn't have a calendar or a watch... Probably last year? Early spring... no, summer. I saw a pansy outside the barbed-wired fence that day.
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: What happened...?
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: At first... he was burning hot... He was mumbling non-stop, eyes wide open, and he was grabbing my sleeve like a lifeline. Like he wanted to tell me something.
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: So I moved closer, to make out what he was trying to say.
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: And what was it...?
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: Dunno, didn't hear. He let go of my sleeve, his eyes still open, pupils all dilated... Pitch-black... like they could suck in everything around him.
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.content: Woody...
attributes.name: Somber Mercenary

attributes.content: So why... why... why didn't you come?
attributes.name: Haggard Looking Man

attributes.text: The man turns his head, and with a blank stare returns the mercenary's gaze.
The black of his pupils incessantly spreads, circulates, and rotates, as if trying to swallow up everything in the surroundings.
As the mercenary faces the other man's glare, he feels as if a hook has extended from out of nowhere, piercing through his ankle and relentlessly dragging him into that black vortex.

attributes.content: So what do I call you now? Heard you go by a different name.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Anything's fine... I was expecting you sooner, Woody.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: After what happened last night, I had so many things on my plate and so many friends to help out.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: If you need any help, you can always let me know. Be it cash or manpower.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Thanks, Cliff, but no thanks. Help is only help when it's on time. But coming from you... it's always overdue.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Right. It's always best to get things done in a timely manner.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: So what are you doing here?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Can't an old friend start with a 'how do you do'?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: ...It's not as simple as 'old friends' between us. What made you think we'd be acting like friends when we saw each other again?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Then what would you rather be treated as?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Anything else, really.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: No need for sarcasm, Woody. I don't even see the point anymore. We're old now, our hair's gone full white.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: This past decade, I've seen my friends getting one health problem after another, and been attending funeral after funeral. Just meeting one that's still alive is hard enough.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: You live so far away, and I doubt I'll ever see your obituary in the papers, so I came see you personally.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: You shouldn't have bothered. Ain't no place for you at my funeral anyhow.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: That's a real shame, Woody. Didn't we make that pact to speak at each other's funerals, all those years ago?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: I'm sure plenty of others would be happy for you to speak at theirs, but mine... just forget about it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I hope you're not thinking I'm a fan of funerals. I only attend them because it's my old buddies in the coffins.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: And where do you sit? Among the friends and family?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Rarely. Unless their relatives ask me to, I usually stand back and watch the whole thing from a distance.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Why? Afraid you can't bear their pain?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Pain is a relatively private experience for the other races. My best guess is that we can only deal with it on our own.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Enough playing like we're friends, alright? I'll put it bluntly for you—I buried him on the hillside behind the POW camp. Have you ever visited him?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Unfortunately, no. I haven't found the time.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: ...You haven't changed a bit.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: So why would Woody go looking for him...?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: It's my fault... I asked him to.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What?! You?!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I thought... on account of their past friendship, maybe my boss could be more... lenient on everyone here.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: How could you be so naive? Jessica... Woody, he...
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Forget it. Now that it's come to this, I don't need to hide it from you.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I'm planning to leave this plate and head to the frontier.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: You too...?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Yeah, my regulars are all getting sent off one after the other, and only us old folks are left. What's the point in keeping the diner open?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Besides, just look at the holes in my walls, after last night's fighting. I don't have it in me to patch 'em up anymore.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I've invested so many years into this place... and enough is enough.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Sorry... I'm so sorry...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What're you apologizing for, Jessica?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Because I didn't do anything. Nothing at all. I'm sorry, I really am...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Don't blame yourself. You're the last person who should be doing that. You're an outsider, and the plate was on its last legs. Just get back to your friends.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: You have your own life to live. No need to work yourself to the bone on our account.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: And the check you gave me back then... Take it back.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: But... that's the only thing I can do for you...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Take it.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...When do you plan to leave, Helena?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Not too soon, I reckon. Still have to say my proper goodbyes, after all.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Jessica shuts the restaurant door behind her and stands in a daze on the doorstep, the check balled up in her fist.
She suddenly lets loose a kick on a pile of snow by the road, sprinkling flakes of white down onto her head and wetting her hair. Some land on her forehead, cooling her burning heat.
She retrieves a tape recorder from her bag and begins rewinding it, playing back the recording she has heard so many times.

attributes.text: '...But you're just a naive little heiress. What can you even do?'

attributes.content: This thought fills her mind as she walks slowly back towards the giant black landship.
...Anyone hear that?
Save us... Those, those Sarkaz suddenly climbed up the plate...
Many people are dead, and the rest of us are hiding in the basement of City Hall... *bzzt*... *bzzt*...
We tried to contact Londinium's garrisons...
But no one's replied... no one at all...
I don't care who it is, but if you can hear this message, please, help us...
You're our only hope...
*bzzt*... *bzzt*...
Why did I even want to be a mercenary?
I can't save other people's lives, or even their livelihoods.
Where have you been all day, Jessica? We couldn't get in touch.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I went... It's nothing, I just went for a walk.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Captain, I... I... really have no idea why we're doing this mission.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Did... you see something?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: ...I saw our colleagues evicting debt-saddled residents from their homes, and putting them on convoys bound for the frontier.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Hey, Teacher's Pet, now's not the time to be staring at your communicator!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Did you even hear what she said?!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I did... and I have news even more absurd than that.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Orders from above: we'll be in charge of security at the bank. We have to stand watch 24/7, and it's up to us to figure out our shift rotation.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: What...? Working security for the bank?!
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Hah...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ... This is so... goddamn... ridiculous...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica, you...
attributes.name: Liskarm
